creator: martin@algesten.com
text:
I have an apache in front of my Tomcat 3.2.1 server. I try to use the ajp13 
communication whenver possible, but found a possible problem when using ajp13 
in combination with form uploads. The browser code will be something like:  

<form enctype="multipart/form-data" method=POST action='upload'>
  <input type=File name=userFile size=30>
  <input name=Submit type=submit value=Upload>
</form>

And on in the tomcat server I have a servlet mapped to the name 'upload'. (See 
http://www.servlets.com/resources/com.oreilly.servlet/ for help on servlet that 
can receive multipart/form-data requests). 

With ajp13, the upload hangs with the console being flooded with the 'Y' 
character. (The servlet gets invoked, but the whole stream doesn't seem to come 
over).

When I switched back to ajp12 everything worked fine however.

creator: nacho@apache.org
text: *** Bug 294 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
